Message.Title: Marissa can't speak for herself_ so X-Yahoo Krisnan spoke for her?
Message.Msg: That was a strange intervu w Bloomberg's Emily Chang..... y an ex-employee tried to speak for Marissa? The take away were: 1- Marissa has not announced her CEO vision for Yahoo going forward (I t has been a month since her hiring) 2- Krisnan said people at Yahoo really love Marissa bcuz she is open and honest w them (we'll see) 3- Marissa wants to replace the GAPING HOLE left by the departure of Levinsohn (That is the COO she needs to run media side like Levinsohn was doing in Santa Monica) 4- Marissa promise to focus on product development and get them out QUIKLY. Krisnan said Marissa wants Yahoo get back to doing what it does best, develop fun exciting products. WHAT ABOUT LAUNCH A MOBILE SEARCH ENGINE W AXIS ??? Pictorial search rather than word search...... which Google is also trying to develop- to search w your camera images.

AAPL should and so should MSFT. Pocket change for them and it is the only thing that will save YHOO shareholders from the debacle of these past years and the gamble of a slow rebuild under Mayer. How about one share of AAPL for 25 of YHOO which would come to about $25 a YHOO share (fair all around) and not dilute AAPL hardly at all. Plus they end up w/ ammo vs. GOOG/MSFT and $12 bil or so cash (ergo picking UP YHOO cheap) and still 20% of AG, the YHOO core, sites, email, patents, Y-Jap asset left over, whatever talent they want to keep (for ex. keep Marissa but get rid of the baby, or visa versa), etc. Winners all around!
